This survey of the work of Mohamed Choukri was taught incredibly well by Professor Elbousty. I came out of the class so much in love with the modern Arabic literary canon

If you are thinking of an accessible North African literature course, definitely take it with Prof Elbousty, especially if you want to hone on your literary skills. He is without a shadow of a doubt amongst the worlds top scholars in his field. Throughout the year, he always made references to Bakhtin and others to place the material into context.

We learned a huge variety of literary skills when reading the trilogy and we analysed them in depth. Dr. Elbousty made us read a manageable chunk every week and this was definitely my favorite class of the year. Everyone in the class participated and had different interpretations and this opened the door for lots of constructive & fruitful debate.

It is incredible how we were in constant contact with the author of the trilogy, Ahlam Mosteghanemi, which is not something simple to organise since she is the most famous modern-day writer in the Arab World. Only Prof Elbousty would have been able to arrange such extraordinary access and for that, all of us were extremely grateful. One of a kind!!

As far as I recall, there was not even ONE time over the past two years when I left from his class not smiling or not looking forward to the next class, even on days when we had exams! It is easy to say that he remains to be the best professor I came across at Yale! I really look forward to taking more classes with him over the next couple of years

What also makes him stand is that he is a well-regarded intellectual in the field and is known for his research. Literally a moving encyclopedia of Arabic Literature!!

Its amazing how creative hes and we all thoroughly enjoyed the writing and poem workshop he set up. The BEST!
